summary: This bill, the Future of Defense Manufacturing Act of 2025, aims to promote innovation in advanced manufacturing within the Department of Defense. It restricts the use of foreign-made additive manufacturing machines, establishes dual-use advanced manufacturing hubs, and mandates programs to manufacture parts using advanced techniques, including additive manufacturing. The bill also includes provisions for certifying new materials, addressing diminishing manufacturing sources, and enhancing international coordination on advanced manufacturing technologies. Additionally, it directs the development of guidance, updates, and a manual for implementing advanced manufacturing across the DoD.
